item.title: Malware Reverse Engineering and Why It’s Essential: My Experience with IMBT from InvokeRE
item.description: Hi everyone, I am continuing my journey and I completed the Introduction to Malware Binary Triage course from InvokeRE in February IDA Edition and March the Binary Ninja Edition.

item.title: My personal thoughts about Maldev Academy Course
item.description: I haven’t written on my blog for a while, but it has been for a good cause balancing my regular work and focusing on the Malware Development course.

item.title: Python Code Start Process in Suspended Mode
item.description: I was working on a format string vulnerability challenge where the process would terminate quickly and was difficult to attach windbg for debugging.

item.title: Format String Vulnerability
item.description: I am continuing again training my skills for OSED certification and one of the vulnerability classes part of C or C++ language, the course covers format specifier vulnerability.

item.title: Reverse Engineering CastRipper v2.9.6
item.description: I am continuing my study and taking a chance to practice more my reverse engineering skills and exploit development I found the available vulnerable application at Exploit-DB - CastRipper to explore.

item.title: Good Stuff Offensive Security Resources
item.description: By Browsing the internet I found a really good github with plentful resources to study :smile:

item.title: Reversing Engineering quotedb.exe (bmdyy) Bypass ASLR+DEP
item.description: I’m continuing to study for my OSED Exam, I downloaded the quotedb.

item.title: Reverse Engineering Vulnserver.exe
item.description: I choose one more vulnerable application to perform reverse engineering and discover vulnerablities if you want to follow along you can download here vulnserver App .

item.title: Signatus.exe (bmdyy) - Exploit Dev POC
item.description: You can access my poc on signatus.

item.title: Reverse Engineering Signatus.exe (bmdyy) - Part 2
item.description: Continuing the second part of my reverse engineering the signatus.

item.title: Reverse Engineering Signatus.exe (bmdyy) - Part 1
item.description: I am currently enrolled on OSED Course, I am taking a chance to practice more my reverse engineering skills and exploit development and bmddy wrote a program called Signatus and I will do a write up of my approach on reverse engineering the program.

item.title: Maldev Resources (Offensive Security)
item.description: Good resources to learn Malware Analysis/Dev

item.title: Windows Native API Book Referece
item.description: A really good book as a reference when working with Windows Native API, the book is old, but still relevant.

item.title: Windows Kernel Undocumented Structures (VERGILIUS's Project)
item.description: If you need to reverse engineer the windows kernel, the vergilius’s project is handy with thousands of undocumented structure covering several windows versions.

item.title: Win32 Api (pinvoke) & Windows Structures (ReactOS) & Undocumented NT Internals
item.description: Two references websites if you need to understand how a particular windows api (InvokeAPI) or undocument structures (ReactOS) works on Windows.

item.title: The IAT (Import Address Table)
item.description: The Import Address Table stores information about the loaded modules imported by the current running processs.

item.title: The TEB Structure
item.description: The TEB (Thread Environment Block) #Just as PEB contains information about the processs, the TEB has information about the thread running in the processs.

item.title: The PEB Structure
item.description: The PEB (Process Environment Block) #The PEB is a data structure that store information about the running process and can be accessed through intel x86 [FS] register at offset 0x30h.
